title: Administrative Assistant Job at Elizabeth Maddeux
content:
Elizabeth Maddeux provides a range of human resources solutions designed to empower your workforce, enhance technical proficiency, refine soft skills, and accelerateorganizational growth for better impacts by enhancing organizational dynamics through a well-rounded and robust human resource intervention.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Assistant

Job Location: Lagos (Hybrid)
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a reliable and resourceful Administrative Assistant to support the day-to-day operational and logistical needs of our office.
	This role is especially focused on managing tools, equipment, vendor coordination, office supplies, and general facility upkeep. 
	The ideal candidate will be proactive, organized, and capable of managing multiple administrative functions that ensure a well-run and efficient work environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain and monitor all office tools and equipment, ensuring they are properly assigned, functional, and well-maintained, including coordinating servicing or repairs when needed.
	Track the usage, location, and condition of assets such as laptops, printers, projectors, and communication tools, updating logs and asset registers accordingly.
	Oversee inventory of office supplies and consumables, conduct regular stock checks, forecast needs, and initiate timely reordering to avoid shortages or overstocking.
	Serve as the primary point of contact for all vendors and service providers including equipment suppliers, courier services, utility companies, janitorial teams, and maintenance contractors.
	Support facility management by ensuring that the workplace remains clean, safe, and well-organized at all times, including monitoring cleanliness of shared spaces, and following up on repairs or safety concerns.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of vendor agreements, service level terms, contract expiration dates, and payment schedules, and alert management when renewals or reviews are due.
	Handle procurement processes by sourcing vendors, obtaining quotations, negotiating prices, raising purchase orders, and following up on deliveries and invoices.
	Coordinate and schedule routine servicing or maintenance for office equipment and infrastructure (e.g., air conditioning, lighting, plumbing) and ensure minimal disruption to office operations.
	Assist with workstation setups, internal office moves, equipment tagging, and ensuring new hires have the necessary tools and supplies upon arrival.
	Participate in emergency readiness, safety compliance, and basic first-aid or equipment safety initiatives within the office, ensuring supplies like fire extinguishers or first-aid kits are regularly checked and restocked.
	Provide general administrative support as needed, including filing, documentation, supporting audits, handling minor office errands, and assisting in the preparation of reports or presentations related to office operations.
	Maintain a responsive and professional relationship with all internal teams and external partners to ensure smooth and uninterrupted business support functions.


Requirements


	HND or B.Sc Degree in Administration, Secretarial Studies, or a related field.
	Minimum 2 years of relevant experience in administrative support, office coordination, or facilities operations.
	Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple priorities effectively.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook); familiarity with inventory or asset tracking systems is a plus.
	Good understanding of office tools, basic troubleshooting, and the ability to follow up on technical or maintenance issues.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills, especially in vendor negotiation and service coordination.
	Ability to work independently, exercise good judgment, and demonstrate a proactive approach to problem-solving.


Salary
N150,000 / Month

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: careers@elizabethmaddeux.com using "Administrative Assistant" as the subject of the email.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted.

title: Business Development Manager Job at Elizabeth Maddeux Limited
content:
Elizabeth Maddeux Limited - Our client is an emerging leader in the manufacturing and distribution of next-generation construction chemicals and solutions. The company offers a comprehensive range of high-quality products, expert technical support, and exceptional customer service. With its innovative approach, they are setting new standards in the construction industry.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Sales
Job Mode: Onsite
Reports To: Senior Sales Manager Industry: Construction/ Manufacturing

Role Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Business Development Manager will be responsible for developing growth strategies and plans to expand the reach of the company’s products and services. 
	He or She must have good knowledge of the construction industry, sales and marketing skills, good communication skills, business development and strategic thinking.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop growth strategies and plans
	Manage and retain relationships with key/existing clients
	Increase client base
	Have in-depth knowledge of products and value propositions
	Negotiate with stakeholders
	Drafting and reviewing contracts
	Identify and map business strength and customer needs
	Research business opportunities and viable income streams
	Follow industry trends locally and internationally
	Ensure that sales qualified leads (SQLs) are converting to opportunities and supporting sales pipeline growth
	Identify opportunities for improvement across sales operations and make recommendations to executive leadership for streamlining processes.


Requirements


	First Degree in Business Admin, Marketing, Civil /Chemical Engineering, Architecture, Chemistry.
	5 - 10 years of relevant work experience selling construction products or services
	Proven experience in sales or relevant role.
	Ability to manage and lead a team effectively
	Excellent knowledge of MS Office.
	Thorough understanding of marketing and negotiating techniques.
	Fast learner and passion for sales.
	Good knowledge of the construction industry
	Self-motivated with a results-driven approach.
	Aptitude in delivering attractive presentations with good communication skills
	Ability to drive and must be ready for extensive travel
	Excellent Reporting.


Core Competencies:


	Good understanding of the construction industry
	Leadership and management
	Stakeholder relationship management
	A can-do attitude


Compensation Package


	Salary: #400,000 net
	Health Insurance


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: careers@elizabethmaddeux.com using "BDM Construction” as the subject of the email.

title: Automation Manager Job at CashXpress Nigeria Limited
content:
CashXpress Nigeria Limited, a fast paced fintech organization in Lagos, Nigeria, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Automation Manager
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Are you passionate about streamlining systems, building smarter workflows, and leading innovation through automation? We are looking for an Automation Manager to take the wheel and drive efficiency across our operations!
	As our Automation Manager, you will play a key role in identifying manual processes, designing automated solutions, and leading cross-functional implementation that powers productivity and scales impact.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field
	Must have served
	Proven experience in automation and process improvement

	Be part of a forward-thinking, innovation-driven company

title: Human Resources Manager Job at CashXpress Nigeria Limited
content:
CashXpress Nigeria Limited, a fast paced fintech organization in Lagos, Nigeria, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources Manager
Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are hiring a passionate and experienced HR Manager to lead and support our growing team!
	As our HR Manager, you’ll play a critical role in shaping our workplace culture, overseeing core HR operations, and ensuring our people practices align with business goals.
	From talent acquisition and onboarding to performance management and employee engagement, your expertise will help drive a productive and positive work environment.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee day-to-day HR operations and ensure compliance with labor laws and internal policies.
	Lead recruitment, onboarding, and orientation processes.
	Drive performance management, employee engagement, and training initiatives.
	Maintain accurate employee records and HR documentation.
	Manage employee relations, disciplinary procedures, and conflict resolution.
	Develop and implement HR strategies, policies, and best practices.
	Support leadership with workforce planning and organizational development.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field (CIPM certification is an advantage).
	Proven experience (5+ years) in an HR leadership role.
	Strong understanding of labor laws, HR policies, and best practices.
	Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
	High emotional intelligence, integrity, and discretion.
	Proficiency in HR software/tools (e.g., Zoho People etc.).
	Close proximity to Oshodi and Mile 2 is an advantage.


Method of Application
Intersted and qualifed candidates should send their CV and a short Cover Letter to: hr@cashx.ng using “HR Manager” as the subject of the mail.

title: Network Operations Center (NOC) Engineer Job at Cobranet Limited
content:
Cobranet Limited; a reputable organization incorporated in 2003 and provides internet solutions. Our footprint and range of products have grown immensely since incorporation and we are proud to provide every segment of society with a reliable link to the digital universe.

Our entire network topology is rugged, dynamic and fully redundant with negligible downtimes: content showing extremely high availability exceeding 99.5%. Our promise is to continue providing innovative solutions at the best feature-to-price and service-to-price ratio.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Network Operations Center (NOC) Engineer
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Lekki Phase 1, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Perform general “system administration” tasks on all elements of the network
	Discover problem areas which could negatively impact system performance or customer satisfaction
	Pro?actively monitor network and system performance.
	Perform network surveillance 24/7, respond to network?reported and customer?reported problems
	Take ownership to ensure that all problems are resolved in a timely and efficient manner.
	Analyze traffic data and trends and escalate areas of concern to the network design authority.
	Escalate problems to third level support (Problem management team) where these cannot be resolved within the Network Operations Centre (NOC).
	Perform general “system administration” tasks on all elements of the network.
	Manage problem resolution using network monitoring/management tools
	Monitor key suppliers service levels and highlight where Service Level Agreements (SLAs) are not being met.


Requirements


	Education and qualifications: B.Sc / HND in Computer Engineering/Telecommunications
	Strong communications skills both written and verbal.
	Capable of making solid, fact-based decisions under pressure.
	Ability to work well in an international, multi-cultural, and high-pressure technical environment.
	Technical experience in a telecommunications or network operations environment.
	Very Good understanding of Fixed Wireless communications Technology
	Cisco CCNA/CCNP certification.
	Knowledgeable to Manage Cisco switches
	Interested candidates must be able to work on a 24/7 shift Rotation.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@cobranet.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
